options.result_text:
You slash at the plywood floor, which appears to work! The hatchet sinks into the wood and it cuts as expected. You take a few more swings and the floor gives out from under you, dropping you into the same pit you had escaped from. The ground comes up on you quickly- 

before eternal blackness flashes before you.
You attempt to slash at the walls of the hallway. Incredibly, though feeling like plywood, the wall deflects every swing you give.
You attempt to slash the wall again, but it still does not give way. On your final swing, some strange force causes the head of the hatchet to disintegrate into dust.

You slash the red door, which promptly splits and splinters. Somewhere on the other side of the door, there's a loud animalistic roar. A butcher wearing a white material, leather gloves, and a black veil over its face charges and smashes through the weakened red door. It is covered head to toe in blood and bone. The butcher raises a meat cleaver and slashes! What do you do?
You slash the green door, which gives a heavy groan as you bury your hatchet into it. The door begins to rattle a bit, as if protesting. You cut it down until it's nothing more than a hole.
You slash the yellow door, or at least attempt to. The door gives a metallic clang and stands strong, though the paint is now slightly affected.
You slash at the yellow door again. The hatchet looks to be in bad shape, and the door stands firm.
You slash at the yellow door again. Your hatchet breaks in two.

You cut into the purple door, with some difficulty. Whatever the sticky substance coating the violet surface is, it seems to be very tough. Your axe gets stuck more than once, though it always cuts through eventually. You swing until the purple door is nothing more than a large hole.

You take a slash at the blue door. Your blow seems to have been deflected at first, but on closer inspection the door now has a visible crack down the middle that is now leaking a seemingly impossible stream of water. Said stream is slow, yet constant, and with a noticeable about of water pressure behind it.

The door smashes open completely like heavy glass. Water begins spilling out of some fixed point where the door once stood, throwing you backwards with tremendous force. You manage to hold on for only a few seconds before being sent careening into the pit. You fall, a mile of water above you...
You slash away at the brown door, which gives surprisingly easily. A gaping hole now stands where it once stood.

You peek behind the red door to find a truly horrific scene. It's a small kitchen whose white tiles have been painted red with blood. Human bodies hang on meat hooks on the ceiling. In the middle of the kitchen is an island, on which a young boy is screaming for his life. His arms and legs have been individually chained to the sides of the island. A large figure dressed in a corse white material stands over him, hacking his left leg off with a meat cleaver. The figure is wearing a chef's hat made of the same white material, with leather gloves over its hands and a black veil covering its face. It snaps its neck sharply in your direction and then charges, swinging the cleaver violently and screaming incoherently.
You slam the door on the creature's face! Some heavy pounding can be heard from the other side that swiftly subsides.
The butcher swings his cleaver into you again and again, screaming incoherent words as he does. The third blow cracks your skull, and before you even hit the floor everything fades to black.

The red door is rather plain compared to the others, much more akin to a standard suburban door. There are six panels on it, and the door handle is round rather than vertical. The paint is very light, as the door's wooden texture can be seen and felt.
Through the hole you've created is a beige-carpeted staircase leading down into absolute darkness. The wallpaper is white with red flowers and a popcorn ceiling sits above.
You move through the hole you've created.
Behind the green door is a staircase matted with old beige carpeting descending into pitch-black. The walls are wallpapered white with red flowers with a popcorn ceiling tying it together.

The green door looks like what would come of an ancient builder attempting modern architecture. The vertical handle especially is barely functional, but the paneling is ornate with carvings like plants and the paint is masterfully coated, making it sleek to the touch and eye.

The yellow door opens into the interior of a warehouse. A short wall sits to your right, with the long wall, and most of the interior, going off to your left. Whirring machinery lines the perimeter, as well as open shelves that house strange and fantastic gadgets.
The yellow door is cold to the touch and completely featureless save for the vertical handle used to open it. It is heavy when pushed.

The purple door gives way to a long hallway decorated with red carpet, expensive wood paneling, a clean white ceiling, and several small glass chandeliers. From where you're standing, it is impossible to see where it leads.

The purple door has paneling resembling an archway that terminates at about the midway point down the door. Below that is a simple box panel. The deep purple color used is sleek, though noticeably sticky.
The blue door gives way to a stone staircase decending into a dimly lit stone hallway. The rock is damp and covered with hard water and moss.

Unlike the others, the blue door seems to get its color from its material rather than a coat of paint. The deep blue is slightly reflective, as well as waxy to the touch. The handle is replaced with a circular inset with lips around its edges.

The brown door takes you to the bottom of a ravine, with a river flowing from your left to your right. Overhead can be heard the sounds of clinking and clanking, though you can't yet quite see what causes them.

The brown door is made of a rough and heavy wood that is little helped by the manner in which it was painted. Said paint seems to have been coated on in heaps without any thought or care, giving the door a very, very rough texture.

You peek behind the red door to find a truly horrific scene. It's a small kitchen whose white tiles have been painted red with blood. Human bodies hang on meat hooks on the ceiling. In the middle of the kitchen is an island, on which a young boy is screaming for his life. His arms and legs have been individually chained to the sides of the island. A large figure dressed in a corse white material stands over him, hacking his left leg off with a meat cleaver. The figure is wearing a chef's hat made of the same white material, with leather gloves over its hands and a black veil covering its face. It snaps its neck sharply in your direction and then charges, swinging the cleaver violently and screaming incoherently.
You slam the door on the creature's face! Some heavy pounding can be heard from the other side that swiftly subsides.
The butcher swings his cleaver into you again and again, screaming incoherent words as he does. The third blow cracks your skull, and before you even hit the floor everything fades to black.

The yellow door opens into the interior of a warehouse. A short wall sits to your right, with the long wall, and most of the interior, going off to your left. Whirring machinery lines the perimeter, as well as open shelves that house strange and fantastic gadgets.
The yellow door is cold to the touch and completely featureless save for the vertical handle used to open it. It is heavy when pushed.

The purple door gives way to a long hallway decorated with red carpet, expensive wood paneling, a clean white ceiling, and several small glass chandeliers. From where you're standing, it is impossible to see where it leads.

The purple door has paneling resembling an archway that terminates at about the midway point down the door. Below that is a simple box panel. The deep purple color used is sleek, though noticeably sticky.
The blue door gives way to a stone staircase decending into a dimly lit stone hallway. The rock is damp and covered with hard water and moss.

Unlike the others, the blue door seems to get its color from its material rather than a coat of paint. The deep blue is slightly reflective, as well as waxy to the touch. The handle is replaced with a circular inset with lips around its edges.

The brown door takes you to the bottom of a ravine, with a river flowing from your left to your right. Overhead can be heard the sounds of clinking and clanking, though you can't yet quite see what causes them.

The brown door is made of a rough and heavy wood that is little helped by the manner in which it was painted. Said paint seems to have been coated on in heaps without any thought or care, giving the door a very, very rough texture.
You sit on the floor and cry. An intense feeling of dread overcomes you.
